column4: Sorry, I was on the phone and must have been leaning on the keyboard
Buggy how.. please be specific  they seem to work for most people
one sec. I'll get you the link to the thread in the forums
depending on the nvidia chip you have, the ones in the repos can cause random hard locks
Most often it is something else..  Someone that has not set the v/h rates for their monitor
nah .. in this case it seems to be a known bug
we hava alot more trouble with people that tried to get the ones from NV and failed to get them right when doing it right in the first place will usually fix the problem
well .. he asked about "newer drivers" ... that's where I pointed him to, but you're right, it doesn't come without OTHER problems
The only nvidia I recommend nvidia drivers for are the 8000 series
the bug I mean is experienced with 7xxx cards .. sorry .. searching for the thread at the moment, I deleted the bookmark I had
I have three 7000 series cards at this location and none have ever had issue and do have effects.
This is all ot  and disscussion more than helping people in channel... SO I am dropping it.. I suggest you do the same
or if you have a Q6600 ... apparently the 32 bit version doesn't see all cores (3 for zeeq, 1 for me)
